resources.string:
Please start on your host system ...
 
 ./udp2notify [PORT]
 
or non broadcast (=IP) mode:
 ./udp2notify PORT -b
 
or non daemon mode:
 ./udp2notify PORT -d
 
or
 ./udp2notify PORT -d -b
 
 ... to receive the messages WITHOUT ANY ENCRYPTION on your desktop. Do not forget to open the port in your firewall. Use 255.255.255.255 for UDP broadcast (EVERYONE GET AND RECEIVE THEM). Sometimes this does not work and you need the hostname or IP-Address of the device running udp2notify daemon.
Sorry, but \'%s\' needs really access to your notifications. You have to add these access in your phone preferences!
